Common cold symptoms may include a runny or stuffy nose, sore throat, cough, congestion, slight body aches, sneezing, low-grade fever, and generally feeling unwell (malaise).
Fever symptoms can include sweating, chills and shivering, headache, muscle aches, loss of appetite, irritability, dehydration, and general weakness.
Diabetes symptoms often involve increased hunger, increased thirst, weight loss, frequent urination, blurry vision, and extreme fatigue.
Headaches can be caused by various factors, including stress, tension, dehydration, sinus issues, and even certain medical conditions.
Allergy symptoms often include sneezing, runny or stuffy nose, itchy or watery eyes, and sometimes skin rashes or hives.
Influenza (flu) prevention involves getting a flu vaccine, practicing good hand hygiene, and avoiding close contact with sick individuals.
